Trust me, so creamy and flavorful and my amazing server's reaction when I ordered them affirmed my decision. Everything from the food, to the drinks, to the service is fantastic. And if you're lucky enough to get Sarah as your server your experience will be enhanced 200%!

5dPMoKx700Q-gOJbR3BJ2g.text: This place is BBQ heaven! I've been to the location off the 17 before, many times, it's always wonderful. Went to this location for lunch with  coworker recently, we were not disappointed one bit. Opted for the brisket, how can one not? SO delicious, probably one of the best briskets in the valley. Service is good and attentive. Highly recommend.

heliMKUyVRFr7XWegEtq8A.text: Having been to the Bobby Q's in Mesa, I was curious to try this location near my office. It was fantastic- food, service, atmosphere were all top notch. 5/5 would dine again  Our server Natalie was excellent and my colleagues will definitely be back!

vdD8ZiGczqSxQgZGbNkYLg.text: This is my favorite Ribs place and I have been meaning to write a review. I took my friends from for a great treat on baby back ribs but was extremely disappointed with the service we received yesterday.   1. The person who waited on us did not bother to serve the corn bread. We had to ask for it.   2. He did not ask us if we needed any refills on our drinks. Nor did he bother to refill my water!   3. He cleared the appetizer plate which had the dips on them when clearly I wasn't finished with the Qrolls that were on my plate.  4. We didn't want to fill up on too much food since we had plans of bar hopping that night so we thought of sharing the entree. As a result we did not get any bigger size plates for doing so. We had to eat out of the small plates. Though he did provide us with fresh flat but very small plates!  5. We were really looking forward to the house made cinnamon donuts that they give with the check. But as usual we didn't get those and had to ask for them. And he carefully placed 4 donuts just because we were a party of four! Well, I have had got more when there were only 2 of us!!  Anyway, the food as usual was very good. The ribs were literally fall of the bone! Yum!   Really sad to have received such a treatment in one of my favorite restaurants!

GMlXyeDnyrzXNhs89-herQ.text: Best BBQ for the money.  If youre hungry and want the best bbq ribs and brisket in phoenix, this is without question, a gem no doubter.  Sides were excellent too.  Service will always keep your drinks refilled.  I will be back for more.

NmEpZwvResrkhXsxVGYlfg.text: My hubby and I went into Bobby Q for a late dinner based on the incredible yelp reviews. From the moment you walk in the door you are greeted by the smell of the wood fired grill and smoked meats. The atmosphere is very cool, intimate, and hip with rustic Arizona flair. Our waiter, Colton, was wonderful and helpful. Now for the best part: the food. We ordered the half rack of baby back ribs and the rotisserie chicken. Both were extremely juicy, tender and seasoned to perfection! We got to choose two sides each so we went with the Brussels sprouts, cole slaw, mashed potatoes, and potato salad. We both agreed the sides were so delicious we would return just for those! Would recommend this restaurant to anybody!!

bgfOi4Yrm4EspL2lCibWjQ.text: This is the best BBQ place I've ever been to. Everything is homemade, and the portions are big enough for leftovers. Our server, Michael, was also very friendly and  helpful. The menu has so many great choices to pick from, his suggestions were spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket, baby back ribs, bbq chicken, beans, loaded baked potato, and veggies.

ZVLT-hoikjPf37ZXxBr8bg.text: Had lunch at this bobby q today.  Had rack of ribs.  very C- quality.  Too heavy on the salt no smoke flavor the coleslaw was frozen in its middle.  the donut rounds were raw on the inside.  Won't return to this store.  Be very very very careful here.  The brisket was decent a C+.  Also very expensice

a-3gNNfP_z2j3h1AXvMKRw.text: Food was ok, great ambiance and family oriented. Everyone was pleasant. Bbq sauce is good!

lcoRMyuidip4pgglsQ9H7w.text: Once again, BobbyQ's didn't disappoint.  It was a pre-birthday celebration for my eldest son.  He ordered the brisket sandwich and he said it was tender and really good. They did not have their typical shoestring fries, but he said the fries were crispy and good. (He does prefer their shoestrings.)  My other son ordered wings, and the plate came with three different sauces and carrot and celery sticks. He said the wings were perfectly seasoned and he loved having all the different sauces.  I ordered the filet cooked medium, and it was extremely tender, caramelized on both sides, and pink in the middle.  I also had a side of grilled corn and a baked potato.  The potato skin was a bit crispy, but not overly baked, just the way I like it.  I hate it when restaurants foil cook their potatoes and the skin comes out soft.  BobbyQ's does it right!   The Biltmore location is the smallest of the three BobbyQ's and has a smaller menu, but the quality of the food is just as great.  There is additional parking in the back and you can come in through the back entrance. The restaurant was full, and quite noisy (it was 6:00), but I expected that. Thanks BobbyQ's Biltmore!

FBMQMwxSixTtqBsAGcCdlw.text: One of our favorite spots to go when in AZ! The best customer service and fantastic food!! There's nothing on the menu that's not good!!

1dMYFPAQwI47XfC3YzMtQQ.text: Exemplary customer service! I love coming to Bobby Q because as soon as you walk in, you'll know to expect friendly smiling faces. Our server Chet was wonderful and so was Joann (I think she may have been the manager?), she was so kind to every table she passed and attentive to needs. Actually, I was really impressed by her when a customer walked in & with a friendly exuberance she said "Welcome back!" He may have been a regular, but the fact that she showed so much pleasure in seeing customers shows a lot about how this restaurant care about the service they provide. After we were done with our meal, another passing server even offered to clear our plates off the table - another clear indication to me of how this restaurant works as a team. Food was also great, I had the half rack of baby back ribs which came with two sides for $21.   If you're not a big eater, you can even share this with another person and be satisfied. Get their sweet tea also! So good! Overall, I enjoyed my dinner and the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half rack of baby back ribs with corn &amp; fries
Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PWSQhnFho9U7boAcvKyfng.text: If you are in the mood for great BBQ, this is the place! My bride and I went to the Pheonix (original) location last year and had a great time. This place is just as good.  The food is consistantly great and comes out fast. Our server, Anne, was very attentive and provided exceptional service. If there were any drawbacks to this location I would say tables are a bit small if you have a party of four and order the "Whole Hog". This place is located in a strip mall so the parking can be a little conjested. We had the whole hog and our friends ordered the prime rib and half rack of ribs. Everything was cooked to perfection. We have made this a regular stop everytime we visit Pheonix.

RvpphYHgIZqwTmh0IkKvqg.text: Very cool atmosphere. Corn bread is great. Ordered q rolls. Brisket was on spot. Tart lemonade. Good for kids and family.

CaYiFVlCV10R7Ams1XBtNA.text: I ordered a bbq sandwich to go, they did not put the bbq sauce on the sandwich or on the side.  I called them once I discovered it and received the worst customer service you could imagine. One of the servers names "Amy" lied to me and said she was the manager, she hung up on me, when I called back I talked to the real manager "Kansas", she gave quite a bit of attitude and said it wasnt theor fault. The managers aren't fit to run a McDonald's which I would expect at the very least since they are the fast food of bbq.

gAOfKujNBrNGpgakbGcuzg.text: I had the vegetarian burger and it was very good!  Can you tell me what ingredients were used?  It was red in color. Thanks

9ELZgqgQrbnYY-Vovszm4w.text: Thank you Chef Mark for your reply. I am sure you are very busy so I appreciate the time you took to read my review. However, this was something that was said. Unless you were present at the table when the comment was said, you do not know. If such a comment was not said, this review would not be here. So I can assure you it was said, hence why I was insulted enough to post a review. Thank you for your time.

clti3EVf3AZCZfJfTywC4A.text: Best BBQ place I've been to in Arizona. The atmosphere is amazing. And the prices are reasonable.

TlSGc-SACZSl7xiKpAYo0w.text: After reading another Yelp review, we followed the prompts.  Everything we ordered, we loved.  Austin was our waiter and if you're really lucky, he'll  be yours too.  We split the two meat dinner and chose brisket and pulled pork.  They're both delish, especially slathered in the sweet bbq sauce.  For sides, mac n cheese and beans are winners.  The queen of it all is the cornbread.  I could make a meal of it alone!  We went to the Camelback location and are looking forward to trying the others.

uIZQLYyYldAgy2PgSKrDvQ.text: Wow! I was super impressed. Our waitress gave us amazing service.  The food was delicious from beginning to end. I can't believe I live right around the corner and have never been. Well we will be back to get our grub on very soon :)

DoH_FDkduXzzdLv5p0CqDQ.text: Quality has gone down hill. Ribs tasted Like your generic, run of the mill type where they boil the meat briefly to get it super tender before smoking process. Result is flavorless meat with no texture. Compensated by slabbing on  a thick layer of overly sweet sauce. Brisket is a bit better. Corn bread was extremely sweet and tasted more like cake. Service was mediocre, rushed but OK. Never got offered a refill on tea. Given the cost and the fact that there is far better barbecue in the Phoenix area, I will definitely not come back.

S9TW8JKp0EOqukfXacpgiw.text: Enormous portions of amazing smoked bar-b-que. Kids menu available for smaller sizes of most of the popular entrees. Austin was extremely prompted and checked back often without being a bother. Highly recommend!

vjNcM5WO0yRg451Wnm3iEg.text: Tasty food! The ribs fall off the bone, the most tender meat I've ever had! The corn bread is to die for. The staff is helpful, nice, and charismatic. This is a must try whenever in Phoenix. The restaurant is clean and had no issues getting a table.

KAs0c4fg0DcpwkqeUqcucg.text: Had a great experience here. Food was fresh and tasted great. Our waitress was attentive and down to earth.  We got free cornbread and free dessert. They even added a free appetizer just because we had to wait a little.   Everyone was gracious and kind. They even helped my friend get out of the restaurant in her scooter. Would dine there again many times. Highly recommended!  PS: the mini doughnuts are very tasty

wQJXgC9mLYHx4mAjWfbPmw.text: Went there for a co workers farewell happy hour. We had a party of 9 and didn't even think about calling ahead of time to reserve an area. The manager was great and accommodated our big party, what AWESOME customer service. We ordered the Hog feast with baby back ribs and brisket, I have one word Deeelicious! We were given warm hand towels after enjoying our BBQ, what a nice surprise. But wait it doesn't end there when we were given or tab we were also handed fresh donuts. O M G, it was heaven in a bag. So go ahead and #TreatYoSelf by enjoying a nice meal in an establishment that has your best interest at heart.

YiPKqg7D6cmWW2piymuGYg.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I've been here a good amount of times and they never disappoint. One of my favorite places in town and very convenient because it is just down the street from us :)). Strongly recommend!

D0yJgr7bonmsCVHcyhe2sw.text: If you're looking for BBQ, you've found it here. Bobby Q is one of my favorite stops for meat around town. The biltmore location is trendy and hip inside and has a great atmosphere. For our group of 7 we ordered two Q rolls, the spinach queso dip, and two whole hogs. It was plenty of food for everyone with some leftovers.   The Q Rolls are my absolute favorite. Incredible brisket wrapped in a egg roll type shell dipped in barbecue sauce. The spinach queso dip was good but overpriced for the portion size. The whole hog platter is amazing and has a little bit of everything for everyone. The best meats are the brisket and the pulled pork. There are two sauces available: the regular and the spicy. I didn't think the spicy tasted much different at all but it had good flavor.   Great service overall and to top it off they serve warm cinnamon sugar donuts for free at the end of your meal! Definitely check any of the locations out.

ZNQCfOsLrZoi3CS4Dn0xGQ.text: The service is nicely attentive and accommodating for our large party. After coming off my Austin BBQ withdrawals, I was looking forward to tender slabs of meat again. We showed up early for our party of 9 and the hostess quickly had our table setup. The dining area is on the dark side with pinpoint spotlights accenting the tables. It was nice but not great for trying to read the dark menus and see across the extended tables. Because of the size of our party we opted for 2 of the whole hog platters to taste every meat, a kale salad to feign being healthy and also a house salad, and a filet. The whole hog does not disappoint and 2 of them is just a grotesque amount of farm animal on a plate. It was all very tasty. I would get the chicken, sausage, pork ribs and brisket again. The beef ribs were gargantuan but tough. The meat did not want to be torn from the bone and could use another couple of hours breaking down. For the sides we had the broccolini, potatoes every way possible, and mac and cheese. The sides were yummie as well but there must be a strong love of garlic because the broccolini was drenched in garlic slime. The broccolini that managed to avoid getting bathed in garlic was perfectly roasted and tender. Overall this was nice bbq, they need to work on the beef ribs and tone down the garlic for my taste.

BKvrxRIRIQlaopCgMl6z1Q.text: Macaroni and cheese to die for!!!!!  It is literally the best one in town.  I have tasted their barbecue chicken pork and brisket, everything is very flavorful.  I have only gotten my orders to go and their team is very efficient and friendly and thorough.   They are very generous with their cornbread and it is delicious also!  It was a blessing and a curse that they are right across the street from my job!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seriously do I need words???  This is killer macaroni and cheese!!!
Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded chicken breast, very flavorful and delicious

kAPHGI8RK12BrBoCQXWIDQ.text: Best BBQ in town.   I love coming here. The staff is is friendly and attentive.  We live the atmosphere here as well.

c3dYDNLvS8qBH1gbPUGu4g.text: We found this restaurant about two years ago and recently tried the Biltmore location.  We were seated immediately and the drinks and food were delicious as always.  We highly recommend this to anyone living in the area or passing through as we travel from California to Arizona and New Mexico.  They should consider opening one in California or New Mexico as they would be a great asset to any city in those states...we will definitely recommend it and of course make it a point when we visit again.

9NgCvxS061l0-XS5KIS9-w.text: On our last day of vacation we wanted to visit the Biltmore Hotel and stop at Bobby Q for dinner. We were going back and forth on ordering choices and then I noticed the Sunday Family Dinner special. The food was awesome, especially the brisket and pulled pork. Our server was delightful and those little donuts at the end put us both over the edge!

281mnTMu7wUqrBNIbZGTgA.text: Great food!. Great location! Great Staff! Will be back when we're in Phoenix again!

Cl13cLs88EZUAex021JLZg.text: Great neighborhood bar-b-que place. Consistent and delicious. Our waitress, Natalie, is excellent!

4SCNMlQOl-18oAuJF_cOFA.text: I had came here the other day and asked for a hot tea and received a dirty mug that was not washed it had lipstick on the cup and still dirty from coffee being in it! My wife had told the waitress and told her we didn't not want it anymore and she brings me another mug and hot water and had said it was due to them being in a rush to get them washed. The new mug she had brought to me was also dirty! Her customer service was very bad, there were not many people in the restaurant at the time we had gone in! She did not check on us but once when we first sat down we had not received any corn bread when that was a main thing my wife liked from this place. This was our first time coming to this location we mainly got to the one on 27 and Dunlap and never had any problems at all.

yFUcno39AIUazq6jictIQA.text: So I have been to the original many times.  Absolutely love it. But this new one is in my hood.  So last night hubby and I went.  Greeted by a friendly young lady and offered inside or patio seating.  We decided on the inside bar area. Great seat...TV's and get to watch the great mixologist! The seats were half booths facing the actual bar.  Started out with craft cocktails. Omg. Amazing.  One drink had reposado tequila/vanilla/cinnamon/lemon. The other was a Hendricks Gin/lavender/egg whites/lemon and edible flower.  Not lacking booze.... which is good because they were $12 .  Then we ordered food. Hubby had the 2 meats with 2 sides. Brisket and pulled pork. Baked potato and baked corn. I had a pulled pork sandwich with one side which is the potato salad. The potato salad I swear is like my Moms. Delicious!  Server brought us the corn bread which was warm and just so tasty.  We did order 2 beers on draft and they were local which I love. No room for dessert because we know they bring a brown bag of mini donuts with sugar. Such a great touch.  Over all just a wonderful night.  Oh and I would be remiss if I didn't mention our excellent server Ann. She was delightful. Attentive-without being intrusive and very informative. Thank you.

69BwDa_MQcM1TUeH67GWkQ.text: By far the best BBQ spot in Phoenix!  I really like BBQs and have tried several spots, this is the best.  Great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food!  I recommend the ribs, the meat falls off the bone.

B80x9Q0xOB0nz8fGoDeZiA.text: Always great environment, excellent food and not to mention the service that's provided... Oh yea ask for Austin!

Fj-b-EUpj3xEbSH41-nEyQ.text: Our first time here, visiting from NJ. We had the baby back ribs and brisket which were both great and too much to finish. Also the corn bread is awesome. Our server Mike was attentive and gave us some solid tips on what to order. Overall, awesome bbq and would definitely recommend!

LyoLKj1Ed1p6-92eqGaW5w.text: Great service. Very quick. Cool setting. Very modern. Food was amazing! Great staff as well! Highly recommend.

ShByD2mUm62MIeA7uV6HVA.text: First time in a Bobby Q! AMAZING food & Service! Emily was our waitress and was on top of it! Great sandwich and ribs! Can't wait to bring my family in next time they visit

sncFyfpiG9QNwpxGznWqpg.text: I went to Bobby Q Biltmore for Brunch, which just started about a month ago and it was AMAZING!!! The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were so good!! I literally tried everything. Avocado Toast, breakfast burrito, smashed potatoes, eggs, bacon and Cold Brew. It was SO DELICIOUS! Seriously everything was! There were a ton of other, unique brunch items on the menu that I didn't get to try, so I'll definitely be going back to try the rest of the menu. Plus, my service from Joe F. was perfect. He was on top of it, plus I got hooked up with donuts and cornbread :). Highly suggest and I'll be back myself.

EnXbXlxd5GHFvidBf_EnxA.text: Great BBQ, much smaller than the one we usually go to off I-17 but same good food and service. Will be back when in the area.

Msy4jOMEP94PtoxV-pdPUQ.text: I'm dropping off only 2 stars since our previous experiences at this location have been great. However, today's pick up order was a disaster.  I called in the to-go order at 11:30 am with no problems, but things went down hill quickly once we arrived. Ashley the "general manager" was very abrasive and abrupt and somewhat belittling to the waiters. One of our entrees was missing and Instead of apologizing for the oversight Ashley just kept saying "well I don't have it".  During this exchange one of the waiters gave us some donuts while Ashley retook the order...the donuts were raw.  told Ashley and she replied "it's not my first day on the job. I told them to wait 10 minutes"  Uhmmm ok... so now we are waiting for the entree to be remade while our other three orders get cold. While waiting, I notice another waiter come to get the same undercooked donuts they gave me.  I told him they were still raw and that he may want to wait for new ones...he put them in the bag and served them to some unsuspecting guest anyway. Our missing order finally comes up and we leave.  Only to get to our location and find that both kids cheeseburgers are practically raw even though we ordered them well done.  Called to the store and asked for the General Manager who I believed was Mark, got Ashley instead. After attempting to explain to her that we were very unhappy with our visit (when Ashley wasn't interrupting or talking over me) she told me that she was "sorry I felt that way"  and that she'd leave us a gift certificate to make up for it. Honestly, I would have been happy with an sincere apology. Hi

kmCzfftpK9oRhlInElN7og.text: Great food nice staff and great atmosphere. Make sure you save room for the mini donuts afterwards!

4jKcazI7MRGETbZyOh_qyg.text: This place just opened. The service is fast and the wait staff have their scripts down. That being said, the wait staff is hesitant to show personality because they're so focused on their lines. The ribs we had were great, the meat separated from the bone easily and the portions were generous. However the brisket my companion had was mushy and when she shared it with me I asked her how she was eating it, her reply was "I thought drowning it in sauce would help but that made it worse", yikes! She's a real trooper, personally, I would have sent it back. The sides really made the meal for me though, and the doughnuts at the end of the meal are a nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get the ribs and load up on comfort food as sides!

trGgws_6YMjEtREshjvrbg.text: So good and close to our hotel. Yummm...cornbread and donuts(for our daughter). We are low carb, so perfect! Grace is awesome!

CWmDVJdLgUCZtr4B26jJ_Q.text: Mother's Day brunch exceeded expectations.  Phenomenal cocktail menu with inventive (high end) tequila drinks, gin + lavender, and a loaded Bloody Mary that had an edible arrangement on top.  I didn't expect to see chia pudding, poached eggs over short ribs and other creative options.  The atmosphere is contemporary, almost hipster, again NOT what we expected.  The topper was excellent, good humored service.  10 thumbs up from our family!

TYE6oVkPpVKg9Hfmu2iG0A.text: Ashley was our server and she was fantastic! We always had what we needed, and she was super friendly as well.   Corn bread $0: We started with a basket of complimentary corn bread. It was soft, warm, and oh so good! I don't eat corn bread often, but this was one of the best I've had.   Baby Back Ribs Half Rack $22: The meat was good, not too tough. I love dipping in extra sauce, and was so excited when they brought out little pitchers of it. The sauce was pretty good. I tried both the regular and spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all. You get your choice of two sides, and I went with mac & cheese and beans. The mac & cheese was really creamy, and not super flavorful but still decent. I didn't like the baked beans too much. I tend to prefer them without meat, but here they have pieces of brisket in it. My friends ordered fries and roasted corn for their sides. The fries were nothing special, and the corn was too bland in my opinion. Of the sides I tried, I would only order the mac & cheese again in the future.   Mini Donuts $0: After we paid, we were given a brown bag of complimentary mini donuts. They were hot and fresh, and could easily become an addiction.   Photo Mention: Cajun Shrimp $14.50  *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

Eic7J1tRukTl1wbKh53xhw.text: Dinner overall was just fair.     The corn bread was nice. It was crispy on top, light and fluffy. The Cajun Shrimp appetizer was delightful and very tasty.    Our ribs were well spiced but barely warm. The mashed potatoes were also luke warm. One serving contained a full half, unpeeled and not cooked potato. The restaurant gladly replaced the serving and offered us a dessert.    For dessert I choose the carrot cake. Unfortunately, it's not traditional carrot cake but a long thin slice with a glaze on top. The cream cheese frosting is one of the best parts of carrot cake. It also had an unusual flavoring to it. It may have been too much nutmeg or an aromatic flavor added to the batter or glaze.     Before leaving, we witnessed staff wiping a table, the chairs, then onto another table with the same rag. Big no-no.

cFueQ_5SBP24LZ5P0HX1cA.text: Recommend it if you're in the valley for a good sit down BBQ restaurant with some drinks. My girlfriend and I split a "whole hog heaven" and we had leftovers for lunch the next day. $60 for the plate but 100% worth it. You get so much variety and it's all cooked to perfection

v_aRVuOVNdUSSe5UpY1fJw.text: After a long flight, we landed and I needed a drink.  Bobby Q can to mind because of their reverse happy hour.    As we walked in, I mean ran in, I jumped on the bar stool and began to place my drink order. Princess Peach.... Oh yeah...   I wish I remember the bartender's name (NJ guy) he was awesome, friendly, warm and very engaging.  He made me feel that I made the right choice by stopping at Bobby Q.   We ordered the simplest dish (French fries) and it was done perfectly.  The spinach dip was super thick and creamy.    This is a great after-anything place!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We landed!

Vj3hBbXNjH0WEESFZF6XHg.text: We're currently here on a trip from California and looked for reviews for the best BBQ in Arizona. Bobby Q's was on the top of the list, and we were excited to get our tastebuds ready for this place. Happy to say they did not disappoint! From the welcoming to the restaurant, to the attentiveness from our server, to the savory food...all of it was top notch! We ordered a feast with links, mashed potatoes and beans and WOW!!!! Mouth watering explosion!!! They are definitely doing a great job at everything they do! Made us want to come back to AZ!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZLTYmwyvjs-PKAdBKSRPyQ.text: Oh Bobby Q, how I wish you were in NYC. This place is super spacious and the waiting staff were also really nice. For drinks my friend had the Pineapple Passion and I had the Bobby's Mule. The drinks were strong and great, namely the Pineapple Passion. And yes, it really is served in a pineapple! For dinner we shared the three meat combo and for $31 it was a steal to adequately share between two people. On top of that, they come with two sides and we had opted for the mac and cheese and baked potato which were really good. For the meats, we had the baby back ribs, smoked sliced beef brisket, and the spicy smoked pink sausage. They were all amazing but the standout in my mind was the brisket. Trust me when I say I highly doubt you can go wrong with any of the meats but if you have doubts in choosing anything, do yourself a favor and go for the brisket. I can only dream of the brisket in NYC to be as good if I'm being frank. If there ever is an off-chance that I'm in AZ again, I know where I'm going back to for solid BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three Meat Combo
Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really good drinks

oPYV9amVTnDXKX907mbC1Q.text: A group of us came here due to a friends suggestion while we were in Phoenix, and it did not disappoint.   Rack of beef ribs: for $30, this is a good deal and you can split it between 2-3 people. Comes with 4 large ribs, and two sides (sides are very small). Ribs were cooked really well with a decent amount of meat on them. Definitely ask for extra BBQ sauce (no extra charge) and bc you'll need it. For sides, we got the greens (brussel sprouts and broccolini) and shoestring fries. Broccolini was excellent!! But shoestring fries were just OK  Two meat platter: for about $30 again, we got the brisket and the chicken. Brisket was super tender and melted in your mouth, while I thought the chicken was just OKAY. Again this comes with two small sides. We got the Mac and cheese which was very creamy and cheesy, and the mashed potatoes which were buttery and smooth  The cornbread starters were excellent like everyone else here has been raving about, but I didn't think the donuts were THAT good...ours came out cold.   Altogether, a solid BBQ place if you're craving it!

WL6y4lEs991lxB3aAbg6lA.text: Just left Bobby Qs and wow this place is great! We were celebrating my moms birthday with a group of 8 and every one of us were impressed. Ashlyn was our server and she did not mess up one order, drink, etc. the food was all cooked perfectly and they were on top of drink refills. Ashlyn surprised us with a little birthday song and desert to top off the great night! We will be back!

i8ZPvm7Hpp2VfI-1TV6OKw.text: Good food. The sides are the best part - especially the Mac & Cheese. Highly recommend for the food.  We've been to this location twice and I've been to the I-17 larger location many times in my life. The Biltmore location is quite small, but we're very glad they have it there, near us.      We were seated near the exit to the bathrooms and the kitchen. Quite often I could hear servers coming through there, talking to each other, using the F-word. That was unprofessional; it's too bad so many people these days use that and other similar words in their everyday vocabulary. Management should speak to their staff about that.    For the entire restaurant, there's only a one-seater restroom for the ladies and one for the men. I really had to go quickly, and someone was locked in the ladies' one-seater room for at least 15 minutes. I finally went into the men's room to use it after 3 men went in and out of there pretty quickly. Not a great experience being in the men's room - but hey - it worked. Sometimes it just takes longer to go - so I don't hold a grudge about the ladies' room not being available (other women with their children kept having to wait as well, and kept coming back to check on the room throughout our whole time there). It's just something to be aware of. The sinks are outside of the two one-seater restrooms. A little different, but it works; no biggie. I've been to other restaurants with the same concept. I prefer having the sinks in the restrooms themselves.       The atmosphere on Father's day was lively and extremely loud, as you can imagine. We could barely hear each other. The worst part was a table of about five adults, 2 kids and 1 toddler. That toddler screamed the high-pitched harsh scream all the way through the entire time were there. Restaurant managers can't do much about that, I suppose. The dads/grandfathers at that table were all at one end and two women were with the kids. The mom of the screamer didn't seem to mind at all that her child was ruining everyone else's Father's Day experience. She almost seemed to be provoking the screams by continuously shoving a sippy cup to the toddler's mouth. Oi vey.     We will be back for sure -- just not for a while, and certainly not on Father's day. Reservations are recommended.

CTRjn8_LvrBO_Dw1Wqp7AQ.text: Made reservations for this Bobby Q location earlier today. Showed up and got a table within 5 minutes of arriving. Ashlynn was our server and she was SUPER attentive & kept an eye on our table from a distance refilling drinks before they're completely empty, made excellent recommendations, and provided us with hot towels! Definitely got the VIP 5-Star treatment here & the environment really provides a really intimate private setting perfect for catching up with long time friends. My favorite Bobby-Q location by far!!

Gbx7BV01DoZzeGOLf3Perg.text: What a great gem tucked by the Biltmore....Bobby Q's is here to stay.  Our first visit & Natalie was such a delight, recommended the beef ribs & they were the juiciest,  fall of the bone perfect. Brussels sprouts were good (I like crispier) and their award winning macncheese. Market salad was so fresh and tasted incredible  Happy hour was fun and packed Keep up the great job

MUHD6j2ithd4M3NhvVgTQw.text: Stopped in for once to try out their happy hour. I think it was Romy who was my bartender, and she was amazing. Gave me the whole happy soop, and educated me on the bobby qs and food items. Had a great happy hour here. Drinks very well made, food was amazing.  Don't forget to ask for some of those fresh donuts and corn bread.   yum!!

DFPwZtvMashDeTCH-6mM1w.text: I love this place and visit almost every time I am in Phoenix. The menu has some great options and the bar has a great vibe.  Great burgers, steaks and of course BBQ! Make sure you are hungry when you come here because the portions are big.

Z3lUdondSugm2DcDfAtWZg.text: Best barbecue in town! Ribs fall of the bone, amazing flavor. Ask for Ashlynn she is the best server ever.

yTZS-oC-lLi-SYx56Ph7fg.text: Great food,  delicious bar drinks,  great service. The mac and cheese is the best.... so creamy.   I recommend it. We'll be back!

Gc-meZ4y3EHJdR2kavLN0Q.text: In town for a few days last week & WOW... absolutely amazing BBQ! Reminds me of a place here in San Diego called Phil's BBQ, but I gotta give credit where credit is due... Bobby Q's is definitely better than Phil's. Even love their name (they ought to have a picture of Elmer Fudd going after Bugs Bunny yelling wascally wabbit on the menu).  I got the full beef ribs order (a little pricey, but well worth it)... 3 bones of big beefy mouth watering juicy meat. Not sure if this is how they do it, but it tasted to me like how my folks used to make them. Boil the ribs to get the meat soft enough to practically fall off the bone & then throw on the BBQ for a bit to get that charred BBQ flavor... perfect! I wasn't wild about the sides, but the BBQ easily made up for it... pretty much too full from the ribs to eat much of the sides anyway. I got the fries, which tasted descent, but were shoestring fries which get cold quickly. Also had the roasted corn, but it tasted like regular corn on the cob with no roasted flavor to it. Again, wasn't bad, but not what I expected by the description. The cornbread was pretty good... nice moistness to it so it doesn't crumble apart when eating. My friend got the pulled pork sandwich & loved it!  Good cocktail & beer selection. I'm an IPA guy, but I didn't know most of the ones here since I'm not local. I told our waiter what type I like & he suggested the Hazy (?) IPA, which was a great choice! We took a Lyft so we could have a drink or 2, which after this IPA, I had 2 more.  Now for the trifecta for a 5 star experience... the service. Our server was Mike, who looks a lot like a younger Chris Pratt. Awesome service & a genuinely friendly person. He saw we had the same cell phone case, which is a beast of a case (the case has to be screwed together & you could drop this thing off a 10 story building & the phone won't break), which opened the door to a short conversation in general. He checked back often enough we never had to wait for another drink or anything. Very well spoken & polite... always said thank you/your welcome for anything we ordered or asked for. If I were local, I'd be eating here 2-3 x's a month & would request his section whenever I'd come. I just might have to drive back here someday for the BBQ when it's not 110 degrees at 9 at night.

cDsqwpLhHIFBQnVLrDl0Aw.text: Amazing staff here. They were so courteous to us when we decided to go to a different location because they didn't have what my friend really wanted. The manager was so amazing and called to make us reservations at the other location.

VggFnev8WZa21jvA2YhZnA.text: I cannot believe I had never stopped by after plenty of times of driving by it. I'm so impressed! Such yummy and flavorful BBQ. I loved the complimentary corn bread at the start of the meal as well as the donuts at the end. We ordered the Q Rolls and Wings as appetizers and they were soooooo crunchy and yummy. The pulled pork sandwich was also delicious and flavorful! Tried the carrot cake for dessert, that was the only think I didn't LOVE as it wasn't as moist as I would like but besides that the entire experience, vibe and food were 10/10. Will for sure return!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn Bread, yummy!
Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings + Q Rolls, best appetizers ever!!!

peIAeCVq7OeqfWjX1TBowQ.text: This visit to the Biltmore Bobby Q's means we've been to all three of their locations. Happily, we've also had great meals at all three! Father's Day seemed like the obvious time to go. Dad's + BBQ = a perfect combination! Our waiter said Father's Day is their busiest day of the year, makes sense. Speaking of our waiter, he was great! Very attentive and nice.  We went at 11 when they opened and didn't have a wait, but they were already pretty full when we left. As always, they started us off with a basket of cornbread and whipped butter. Delish.  My husband got the 3 meat combo with baby back ribs, brisket and pulled pork, he loved them all. His favorite were the ribs. Super tender, flavor all the way through. My 8 year old son had the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese on the side and he destroyed it! If you haven't taken your kids out for BBQ yet, do it. Even picky eaters will like it.  I had the BBQ loaded baked potato with pulled chicken, it's my go-to choice at Bobby Q's. You can pick any of the meats to top a gigantic baked potato. I could only eat half of it! Another reason our waiter was great is that at this location they normally only offer the BBQ potato during the week, but he asked the kitchen to do it anyway, and they did. I had corn as my side, and it was the only real miss. Just underseasoned, nothing special.  The cutest thing is that you get a paper bag of cinnamon sugar mini donuts when you leave!

FVGRLUahyDrDY8LKobDTfQ.text: Came here for happy hour with some work folks. We actually won their business card drawing contest so got some free appetizers. The happy hour drinks are pretty solid. $5 for a pitcher which gets you about 3 beers from it. And they have some good beers for the pitcher not. Not just your normal domestics. For apps we got the brisket nachos and the pretzel. The nachos were large in size. The pretzel was big as well and came with beer cheese, marinara, and a mustard sauce. The pretzel was delicious so we ordered another. Patio seating was nice as it's covered so stays cool during the summer. Definitely will be back for some actual bbq.

TOj79CCI6G-XTGkUJRVrIA.text: Right off the bat, I fell in love with the patio dining area. From here, I get the most beautiful view of the  stunning bar. The bartenders are friendly and attentive. 0sF8ZOIa2myLw8ps3Y6MZw.text: This place is incredible ! They provide such a consistent product at all of their locations , we particularly love the Biltmore location . esbuiDwGRlN02vHjiMDG-A.text: First time at this Bobby Qs location. Regular at the original location on I-17.  Man, what can you say. These guys know how to cook meat like no one else. The brisket is the best in the world. The baby back ribs also qualify as the best ribs I've ever had.  Cornbread to start is excellent. Best cornbread anywhere.  They also make some mean drinks. The old fashioned with the maple syrup is two thumbs up - best old fashioned. The princess peach - don't let the name fool you - is a zesty refreshment.  Service is very good and the decor is intriguing with the feel of something special yet comfortable and relaxing. Of course the smokey meat flavor wafting through the air is the best part of the decor. Decor A+  Can't recommend this place enough. A lot of the bests are available right here. These guys know what their doing.

8sH4oZcElSePZPbGJIavvg.text: I have found out about this from a friend who raved about it. And as someone who grew up on barbecue, and has tried everywhere in the valley. This was up there with the best. Try to sit on the patio, and enjoy the great service !!

fUOwKIefWFFFf3s3crpxBA.text: Thanks Colton for being a great waiter!  Made our first time at Bobby Q easy and fun.  Accommodating to kids and comfortable on the patio with fans and misters.  Q rolls are delish and the meat platters are very generous portions.  We have a whole to-go box with leftovers.  I spy burgers at another table and want to try those next.

FQciNdmKeA-Pu6EMzJD_SQ.text: Best BBQ place in Phoenix! Definitely will be back and can't wait to try their brunch.

yyBYKVmS8RqFwLYJRujZzg.text: Out of all the restaurants I've been to in the world, Bobby-Q has a special place in my heart.  Bobby-Q came up while I was searching for some good restaurants in Phoenix. They take reservations so I decided to book a time slot for myself!   I arrived on time and the two gorgeous ladies at the front desk greeted me and led me to my table, a perfect spot that was facing the TV, which was also playing my favourite sport - the NBA. Within a minute, my server came by with the menu. I ordered a cocktail, and my server pointed out that the Q-Rolls are one of their best sellers.   When my server was back with my cocktail, some water, and cornbread, I ordered the Q-Rolls as an appetizer, and Half Baby Back Ribs as my main. I sat back and enjoyed the game with my cocktail, and my food came in no time. The Q-Rolls were amazing - the crispy outer layer wraps the pork which was tender and perfectly smoked. The edges of the pork were slightly crispy too which I really enjoyed. I didn't even bother dipping in too much of the sauces because it was so delicious that I didn't want the sauce to overpower the actual food.   The Baby Back Ribs arrived with the two sides I ordered - brussel sprouts and corn. I was clearly trying to be healthy, which is why I avoided the tempting mashed potato and mac and cheese. Without much expectation for the sides, I bit into the brussel sprouts and boy were they good! I would have mistaken it as an actual dish if it weren't placed in the same plate as the ribs. The corn was also the best "side dish corn" I've ever had. I love how Bobby-Q puts in effort even in their side dishes. Finally onto the star of the night - the baby back ribs. Trying to be civilized, I used fork and knife throughout my meal. I had my fork in the meat, and my knife ready to cut a piece off. I was not expecting the meat to just slide off the bone...It was so tender, and so well cooked that it took me zero effort to eat baby back ribs with a fork and knife! I don't think I have ever had such good ribs ever in my life.   During my meal, my server came by couple times. I usually like to use the word "check up on me", but he just came by casually to have a short convo with me about my food and my trip, and it felt like an actual non-obligated conversation. I learned that he was from Thailand which I will be visiting soon! The super friendly and (very) attractive manager, Joanna also came by to see how things were with the parties around the restaurant, including myself. And to make my whole experience at Bobby-Q even better, the owner of the restaurants came by to say hi and thanks after he heard me saying good words about the food. Kindest old man ever.  I never pack my leftovers when I'm on vacation, simply because I have planned out all the restaurants that I want to visit. But I couldn't stand such amazing food to go to waste, so I packed them all for a late night munchie.  After I got the bill, my super amazing server brought me some of their dessert of the day to go. I was already so full from the food, but secretly had a bite in the car...and ended up finishing it all. I would give this place a 6/5 star if I could!   There are too many restaurants nowadays that try to satisfy the customers while prioritizing their profits, but Bobby-Q make sure that every single customer leaves with a happy tummy and smile.   Thank you Bobby-Q for really setting the bar high!! I will come again if I ever visit Phoenix.

DZq5JbRrD8ENXDMQEK45FA.text: Love, love this place! You can never go wrong with their ribs or their cat fish. Just recently discovered their naked wings that they give you with several different sauces to dip in. Great atmosphere and amazing barbecue smells. And you can't beat the freshly made hot donuts they give you at the end of your meal.

_1tEZBOoXDwyI2QLpjvYXA.text: Overpriced for the portion sizes. I like my brisket sliced and trimmed and this was more like chopped. Service was prompt though. Taste was just ok overall but not memorable. The ambiance was pretty cool - kinda rustic elegance.

F3sr5-hAksLTC3lOVeO1Gw.text: Bobby Q is the best! The food is delicious and the staff is amazing. My family and I came to visit Phoenix from California. We decided to grab some dinner at Bobby Q's and we were not disappointed! We waited only 10 mins to be seated. Our waitress Kansas was great! The food was delicious!

qlSCTD44eLCyOHl8LHiyCQ.text: It's been a year since I've returned to Bobby Q's and I hate to say this but I was disappointed with the Biltmore location.  I honestly don't know what happened but it might just be the fact that I  visited Kansas City and Dallas for some serious wood smoked bbq and  that may have embedded a new standard for my BBQ taste buds.  I had the beef ribs and the brisket and I would recommend the beef ribs over the dry and non-smoke flavored brisket.  I would have to call out Bobby for not smoking their meats because it had a clear oven baked flavor over a smoked filled, wood-tasty meat.  If you are Phoenix raised resident then Bobby is a protein rich  bbq, but if you were raised in the Bible-belt, then Bobby Q would be reminiscent of a fourth round draft pick on the corner of your newly developed Kansas City or Dallas suburb with small yards and a newly built Costco around the corner.  The home grown art and science of backyard bbq masters who pick the perfect balance of wood and charcoal would frown on this suburban destination.

G3iPn41a4V0aFfWvQ6Xo5Q.text: My boss at my job recommended Bobby Q's for dinner so my friend Katy and I went today. Now mind you we only go to Lucille's at Tempe Marketplace for ribs but Bobby Q's was just asawesome. Our waitress Ashlynn was so awesome that we both were surprised on how she treated the older couple behind us by listening to their concerns about how to order their meal she had eye to eye contact at all times and was very respectful. Now about the meal it was very yummy especially the corn bread, chicken and baby back ribs that fell off the bones, baked potato with everything and Mac and cheese. We got our check and we also got a small bag of just made cinnamon and sugar small donuts.  We will go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby Q - Biltmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cornbread

a_VpBh98i1Bq6VCB8ZmliA.text: Me and the family came together as a party most of us ordered a burger of some sort, the beef burgers were good a little bland (no seasoning whatsoever) but you could definitely taste the beef itself with that earthy iron taste that only hand packed beef has, the cheese was real cheddar which is nice yet the garnish was very low quality though as well as the fries which is ok since we were here for the meat...  but DO NOT come here if you would like anything vegetarian!   They have a cave man barbarian who run's the kitchen and he clearly does not know that green's can taste great.   One of our member's had ordered a veggie patty no garnish (pickles and onions and thousand island dressing which is odd) the veggie patty was not actually a veggie patty but a Japanese style rice cake with a few beet's and maybe one or two whole black beans, it was hideous and disgusting it fell apart and was like biting into a bowl of minute rice with beet's.  Now as a side note we all eat many different thing at many different places in many different states and this was not a veggie patty yet a grain patty, because rice my dear barbarian cook dummy is not a vegetable please check your food pyramid.     Now some people may like potatoes that taste like potato salad but i am sorry when we go to a steak or barbecue joint we expect "butter and potato" which in turn is just mashed potatoes not potato salad, here they use an over abundance of sour cream, green onions and celery all mixed in and whipped till they are a bleach white color, the base was a great try with red russet potatoes for that good wholesome taste but it was just sour cream overly tart and oniony no potato taste at all it was depressing.   Now for the aesthetic of the restaurant it was a nice enough looking place, a little shoddy for being a biltmote location, the plants were a nice touch but the bugs EVERYWHERE flying all over the place were just gross we kept clapping trying to kill them over our meals but couldn't they were just too fast and abundant. The air was cool yet humid inside most likely since its swamp cooled inside you can tell there is some vacuum coming from the front doors sucking air into the restaurant pulling in humid misted air thru the 3/8th inch gap.  The customer service was absolutely horrendous the waiter did not once ask how we were or how our food was, it may have been since he saw us all clapping and swatting trying to kill the flying bugs but as a CSR this is inexcusable.   The staff near the door were friendly and told us to have a good day, overall i'd say its definitely NOT worth the visit, the average price is a solid 25$ no tip no drink for a measly burger (butter bun was great) and dry hard fresh fries, sour potatoes, soggy pulled pork (was good) and sad vegetables.  Don't visit this location unless you want to shed a tear knowing culvers 8$ meal is much more seasoned and rich for 1/3rd the price which is a fast food chain    Thanks for reading but heed my warning

w5KestvvHYJUBR4nnocaPA.text: Bobby Q is fire. Every time I'm craving bbq it's not even another place I think of- Bobby Q is the spot. The ribs are so tender they fall off the bone. Ribs are A1! The beef ribs are hugeeeeeeeeee!! So huge & sososo good. I didn't even get to the delicious sides- the mac & cheese is BOMB! Hella cheesy with a great taste, fries are always good & so is the baked potato. Tonight I had the rib eye & it was cooked perfectly, so juicy & melted in my mouth! The fact you get free cinnamon sugar doughnuts  So clearly Bobby Q is the best! Oh & their carry out is just as good as eating there! Double points for that one.

782moGwkxDN79Gmqg4YIyQ.text: Great service, loved the chicken. We got bobs salad. The atmosphere is nice. Thank you!

IzuAx-p-dYY6HGuGD0HBng.text: Had dinner with my ex neighbors who used to live in Seattle. I wanted a great barbecue place that had a good rating and this was it. The barbecue chicken fell off the bone, the cornbread was addictive and my pulled pork was out of this world. We sat outside which was so pleasant as they also have water sprayers if it it's too hot. My neighbors said that they never knew about this place and that they were definitely going to come back. Very fun atmosphere as well!

K1xhJZspUbZCjMAq3_-m-A.text: When your licking your fingers instead of using a wet rag to wipe them clean you know the food is good. That was my experience today. Growing up my family made the trip to the west valley location off the I-17. I'm happy to see this restaurant grow and now be in my neck of the woods. Slightly different menu but still the delicious great Smoked BBQ taste.   Ashlynn was my server today who by far exceeds too customer service. My table dined on some tasty smoked wings that came with three different dipping sauces. Shoestring Potato Fries that are the best I have ever had, cornbread and a tasty watermelon cooler to wash it down. Everything was served warm and freshly cooked. Not only did the food taste well but the presentation made everything tempting to eat. So tempting the tables around us were eyeing our food.   The ambiance is nice and the decor is a modern BBQ house affair. There is patio seating with TVs and full bar. They even give you doughnuts to go. Had a great experience and will be back due to the level of service from Ashlynn.

Mt0YwP2DE9tXxEDkXD1LQw.text: My yelp guy pal Travis T. Wrote a scrumptious review today, it had me drooling and craving BBQ. So, hubby and I walked into Bobbie Q today at the Biltmore. It's smaller than the other Bobby Q's, but just as tasty, with the same menu!  The babyback ribs are really good! The meat is so tender, but remains a good chew and char! Perfectly smoked with just a brush of BBQ sauce!  A full rack is definitely shareable, or if you are absolutely starving, you might be able to tackle it!  I had the brisket, I asked for a leaner portion, and they delivered! It was perfect! I got the choose 2, so my other protein choice was the smoked chicken. I actually didn't care that much for the poultry. But the brisket was so satisfying, I was happy with it!  The cornbread was scrumptious! Lightly sweetened, with whipped butter!  At the end of the meal, we were served freshly made cinnamon and sugar doughnuts, brought in a brown paper bag! Who can turn down a hot doughnut? Not us... they were so good!  Overall, I think if you're craving BBQ, you can't go wrong at Bobbie Q's

vHA5DYwIQDcTniHyVbPivw.text: Our group of 6 finished backpacking at Havasupai and decided to end our weekend with 2 Whole Hog Heavens! 4ln2xjxfPz8SKyOuYczZ0A.text: Our first time there we were in heaven! The food was great, we enjoyed the delicious Bar B Q, the greens, the cornbread.  Being from TX we know good Bar B Q. That's NOT what I'm use to paying.  I believe it came with cornbread & a side but still way too much for a sandwich.  Will return it's that good.

BwMf3DT0JFvSV-6p6zFbgg.text: Super fun location and bar area. Love the little patio for brunch and bubbles and the half price bottles are a bonus. Service is all smiles with an energetic atmosphere. Definitely be back for brunch.

XCjE70GprY7vtlUnyOuTfw.text: Great food and great service.   The short rib hash in their brunch menu is great. Brunch also comes with those tasty little corn bread bites.   Their happy hour is great, lots of choices, good mix of vegetarian choices as well. All the food we've gotten here has been stellar, no complaints.   Last but not least, Mike is the best server. He's super attentive, very thoughtful, and goes above and beyond to make sure you're having a good time and enjoying the food, drinks, and ambiance here.

reHO2yBkSR3qj7RpXn1MLg.text: We love this spot! It is a great locally owned biz where you can get your BBQ fix! They are great for large groups and catering as well.   I love their steaks and BBQ and you can't go wrong with any of their sides. My favorites are the mac 'n' cheese and q-rolls. They also have tasty cocktails! I am obsessed with their Q-lina sauce! It is almost like a combo between BBQ sauce and steak sauce. I actually go in just to buy it for our house. :) You can't leave without trying some of their cinnamon sugar donuts, either.   They also have great happy hour and nightly specials so check their website for more on that! The best part? You can make a reservation via the Yelp app! Yes, please. Everything right at your fingertips. We'll see you soon, Bobby Q!

NBZhjD6tXSEJ8r-SSLOxiw.text: Bobby Q has quite the dinner crowd.  Dining area was full so I sat next to the bar.  It was dark like a fancy steakhouse.  Bartender was nice and knowledgeable about the menu.  He suggested the combo with baby back ribs and beef brisket.  Shoestring fries had lots of crunch and a delicious fried potato flavor.  Steak fries were also very crunchy but the flavor was not as tasty as the shoe string fries.  Baby back ribs were fall off the bone tender with a sweet slightly tangy carmelized bbq sauce.  Nice smoky flavor from being smoked in mesquite and almond wood.  Beef brisket was extremely tender with a sweet sauce that had a bit of a tangy component and a little bit of a spicy kick.  For dessert fresh donuts were brought out.  I liked the fresh fried flavor with a bit of sweetness from the sprinkled on sugar.  Arizona has some impressive bbq.  Next time I visit Bobby Q Bbq I might try a variety of their meats to go.

pvsHCaPjCyXAJ9Bid_usIA.text: BobbyQ's was recommended to us by our hotel concierge during a recent trip to Scottsdale. It's located in a strip mall off Camelback Road. The restaurant is casual and energetic, bordering on noisy. They have a variety of smoked meats and we tried the pork and smoked sausage which were delicious and generously sized. The sides which accompanied our dinners were good but not great. The macaroni and cheese was creamy but lacked flavor. The corn side was swimming in liquid but tasted fresh. We loved the complimentary corn bread which came to our table warm and lovely. We'll go back for the tender pulled pork. It's definitely the best we've ever eaten!

g6Zn9x8ubNM9xxiKQy_2MQ.text: The last review of 2018: dinner at the bar at Bobby Q. I had eaten at another Bobby Q location in the past and had fond memories so I was excited to check this place out. It was hit and miss.. hence the 3 overall. They certainly have some stuff going for them and some stuff that didn't blow us away...  Hostess was super friendly as we didn't have reservations and it was New Year's Eve. As we were waiting for a table two seats at the bar opened up so we took them. Two bartenders took care of us and the service as great. Friendly and attentive without feeling rushed, we ended up not being in the mood to drink but our waters were refilled and we weren't treated like outcasts for not ordering a cocktail. Service - 5.   The interior is super nice, I really liked the vibe. The bar is cute and has some lights on it and they have a really nice outdoor section in the front. It looked really cozy, they had heaters going and it was covered. Would definitely be a great spot to hang out for drinks. Ambiance - 5.   After ordering our meals, they brought us a little basket of cornbread. I'm not huge on cornbread and neither is my girlfriend but dang this cornbread was GOOD!! Honestly, probably the best cornbread we have had around. Cornbread - 5.   We both ordered 2 meat plates which come with two sides of your choosing. When the plates arrived there was a HUGE amount of food but for the price made sense. (~$27 each). Portion size - 4.   At this point, we both had some hits and misses. I do want to note that they bring your meat out with sauce on it. Most bbq places I've been bring it on the side or have it on the side at the table. My girlfriend doesn't like a lot of sauce, if any at times, and there didn't seem to be anything on the menu indicating that it comes with sauce already on top. Our fault for not clarifying for it to be on the side anyways, but just a heads up if you're picky about levels.   Pulled pork - 3. Pretty decent, I liked the sauce so it made it tasty. Not bad.   Brisket - 3. For brisket this was on the better end of what I've had in the past.. but didn't blow me away either. The sauce helped.   Mashed Potatoes - 2. Just not great. Could be worse. For the price point didn't seem worth it.   Mac N Cheese - 3. Not too fancy that it's too rich but pretty basic.   Potato Salad - 3. Tasty but again nothing to write home about.   While you get a ton of food, we just felt like we've had better bbq for a cheaper price point. But again, the atmosphere and service were great so you pay for that too. We didn't try any of their cocktails but they had some that sounded good so perhaps that is the way to go if you stop in.   All in all it was a decent experience I'm just not sure if we would return unless in the area or with others.

JYxuD0DxfPTSaSeQs_5YLg.text: First time here today and gotta say I'm glad I finally tried it! I ordered the three meat plate with brisket, chicken, and sausage. The smoked brisket is so so tender and the sauce nice. I don't care for the sauce on the chicken though it's just not my thing. The cornbread though... it's amazing gotta have seconds

hcghu_vBFF3zL4-32AAMrQ.text: It's a Sunday and we are having a great morning and we decide that we would love to have some bbq for lunch.  Not sure where to go, our daughter tells us that this place is great.   She is usually spot on for recommendations.  We go to the closest location in the Biltmore and from the minute we walked in, this was a winner.  The decor and ambiance was exactly what we were looking for.  This is not a cafeteria feeling place.  It is warm and comfortable with a great little patio and bar area.  We sat in the bar and were waited on by Emilee.  We both ordered the Brisket.  When it arrived, the portions of roasted corn, cole slaw and brisket were generous.  The brisket was juicy and had an amazing flavor.  Emilee brought us the sweet bbq sauce and the spicy bbq sauce.  We tried both and figured out that they were both delicious but were even better if we mixed them.  Needless to say, we could barely walk out of here from being so full.  It is now our favorite by a long shot.  If you want great bbq in a fun place with a great vibe, come here!  Well done Bobby-Q!

rBWMTPKsmiUdehgiXepASg.text: I think it's over priced) and I have no qualms about expensive ie Mastros or Steak 44, etc).  1 entree split, an Ap, a kid meal & 2 drinks for lunch was $100 (w/tip).   I'll return but it will definitely be on HH.

Ly-NoeOIHmUbCIzcGFb_eQ.text: Went for my husband's birthday and again we were pleased. VXyA3VVgQum__oxcYN-TqA.text: It was lots of fun to meet with extended family here. The wait staff was great as were the wine and mixed drinks. For the price the food just did not have the wow factor that we had had at the other location. I had ordered the half rack of baby back ribs which did fall off the bone but the flavor was just a little bit different. I also order the Q roll as a appetizer which had good flavor but was dry even with the dipping sauces. I also felt the food was maybe a little too salty maybe that was the difference for me that night. I would return to this location for drinks and lunch but most likely not dinner.

slW2LBDHCbJkpOh-SrPEZw.text: We came into town for visit with friends and family. We all heard about the new Bobby Q in the Biltmore area. it has been around for close to a month.  I can honestly say, I know this is not KC BBQ, but it is really darn good! The only recommendation is to get some great signage out in front. I know you are new, but I almost missed the place with the banner.  The decor is surprisingly nice and friendly. I was not expecting this look and feel as the location is in a strip mall. That being said, it is done very well inside.  On our visit, the staff was marvelous, from getting seated to our waitress to the Manager, everyone really went out of their way to make you feel welcomed. It felt very real and warm and not fake. Kudo's to all, especially our waitress Rachel. She was fantastic and really took care of us.  We ordered the Family Feast for our entree. If you want to try something new, this platter has an assortment of meats to try, Ribs, Chicken, Brisket and more. It is more than enough for two and could possibly feed three and is a great deal at $39!  The chicken was very moist and tasty, the rib meat literally fell off the bone and the other items were also tasty. I was a bit surprised that the BBQ sauce does have a bit of a bite so be ready. Nothing bad, but surprising for a sauce.  The house salad was made as requested and to top it off they give you a few small sugar donuts that have the look and taste of beignets. Really tasty!! :) I wanted more of those to go with the gelato I got across the street.  So in summary:  Ambiance - 5 Service - 5+ Cleanliness - 5 Food quality and taste - 5 Bang for Buck - 5  I wanted to try their steaks, but the bang for the buck on this platter cannot be beaten. I highly recommend this establishment as they nailed all the things you look for in your dining experience! :)

WgIVSfDECq55IjmBNfEM-A.text: First time here and forever returning customer. Kansas was our server. She was a delight and let me feel confident in not knowing the menu, but choosing the right meal and drink to pair.

icnpFT3EqTHUhrzF1Mz2XQ.text: This place isn't bad, by any means. If you're in the mood for BBQ at dinner time with a cold beer, they've got you covered. It's got a great vibe with the owner coming around to ask how things are.  We split The Whole Hog between two of us, and maybe I'm just a fat kid at heart, but it felt like it should've been a bit bigger. Ribs are definitely the way to go here. I love brisket but this one was sort of meh.  My expectations are probably a bit off-kilter, too, as I frequent the fantastic Little Miss and Texas BBQ House in S. Phoenix.

jOKve2uJQx5EGE4MeJ-n-A.text: Delicious food. The cornbread was very good, the pulled pork was just right and my husband said the ribs were fantastic.  When you step inside you forget you are in a strip mall as the decor makes it look like you're in a 100 year old building. When we are in Scottsdale again, we will definitely co.e by again.

MG2cfm8R0qjxtka9cf0i-w.text: This is an awesome BBQ place! Super good and very accommodating. They went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our meal. Everything was delicious and very fresh. Definitely coming back to this location again.

KGN0x9wcXSjtEcpD1kLEXw.text: It's been many years since we've been to the original Bobby Q's on I-17 near MetroCenter and we've certainly never been there as much as we used to go to it's predecessor, Bobby McGee's. However, after spending a weekend camping with the Boy Scouts and trying to come up with a place to eat on our way to Zoolights, I remembered seeing that Bobby Q's had recently opened a new location at 32nd Street and Camelback and we decided to give it a try.  Located just East of Safeway, in the space where Mexx32 used to be housed, Bobby Q's is a dark, warm space that is very inviting. Because our November weather is so perfect, we chose to sit on the patio and it was great.  Our server, Joseph, did an excellent job and filled us in on the specials and his favorites. I went with the three meat platter and picked babyback ribs, brisket and pulled pork along with a side of grilled vegetables. My wife and kids were all in the mood for burgers and they all ordered the Smokehouse Burger.   Everyone enjoyed their meals very much! The meat on my ribs was perfectly cooked and falling off the bones and my brisket and pulled pork were excellent with just enough bbq sauce added to flavor them perfectly. The rest of my family enjoyed their burgers and even though the boys didn't finish their burgers, they took the leftovers to go and warmed them up for lunch the next day!  Service was very attentive and they made sure that they refilled our sodas, tea and lemonade whenever they started to get empty. Pricing was very reasonable for a family of four and this is certainly a place to which I would return.  Bobby Q's, you're a hit in my book!

_XyFBJ_a5V3Z2dVrx8-2OQ.text: This is a good place to go for lunch. Service is friend and price is reasonable. Today we had a going away lunch for a coworker and we received 2 complimentary desserts. The only downfall is the food took too long to come out. Our team had to wait to get their meal and no one ate until the last person received their meal (me!). Poor colleagues had to wait because of a printer problem. Overall, was good. We even got free and fresh donuts. Knowing my team.. we will be back! Thank you!

YMwPwczdXiCstsYSMqV7Gg.text: OMG BOBBY Q'S YOU ARE TESTING MY PHYSICAL BEING WITH YOUR AMAZING FALL OFF THE BONE RIBS WOULD YOU STOP????? I was raised in Georgia, so barbecue was basically a food group that was presented at basically any family gathering, duh. I guess you can say that after having BBQ so many times, I can probably tell you what is quality and what is not. Bobby Q's is where it's at. I had such an amazing experience here.   I brought the boo a week or two after the grand opening: the first thing on our table were two perfectly baked corn bread rolls with a dollop of butter (basically already speaking our language, southerners put butter on freaking everything). They were so delicious! We had to stop ourselves from eating them because we did not want to spoil our appetites for the Q Rolls, our main entree, and the mac & cheese side. We decided to split a rack of ribs between us for our entree. The ribs, we learned, were smoked in house and were brought out with the three kinds of signature Bobby Q sauce. As soon as I tried to cut into a rib it fell apart, clean off the bone- something you don't see very often unless the chef knows what they are doing... and BOY did they know.   We basically ate that in 3 minutes flat and then chowed down on some Q Rolls: small taquitos stuffed with beef brisket and served with a chipotle-style sauce. Our side of mac and cheese really could not be beat. Some BBQ restaurants will do the most with everything in the restaurant BUT mac and cheese. This was so good, you could definitely tell it was freshly made (no clumps, super creamy and heavy).  In short, Bobby Q's is definitely now my top choice of BBQ.   -Outdoor seating  -Outdoor seating does not allow puppers -Great date night spot  -Bar shares the outdoor patio

gtiJpLLJfUBaXbKqIWWiqg.text: This is a great addition to the Camelback corridor restaurants. The ribs and steaks are the specialty and amazing. YXKH1gtb0q-QHNUHWCKsPg.text: While in Phoenix area for spring training we ate here. Family of three including a 12 year old boy. FQd0lwA6Lgw7NXJaRobGYA.text: We've been to all the Bobby Qs locations and they never disappoint. This location is a bit small but still has the Bobby Qs feel. The food is nothing short of amazing!

tmT4hE-9PKaBT6Ix_04ISg.text: Bobby Q's has never disappointed me, or my business colleagues.  I highly recommend anything on this menu from salads to steaks.  Their mac 'n cheese is super creamy, thick with 4 cheeses.  Their Q roll is the taquito bomb -  a must try appetizer.  I usually get the pulled pork sandwich, but recently, I had one of the best burgers ever at Bobby Qs.  There is a 1-star rating from Mike L. which I cannot believe to be True.  I've spent a lot of time in KC, South Carolina, and Texas areas in my lifetime.  Eating out a lot on business and I am a BBQ aficionado .  Believe me,  I  have had some really great BBQ, and some really bad BBQ (especially in KC where even bad BBQ can stay open because BBQ there is like burgers and pizza everywhere else).  I have about 30 BBQ books I've collected over the years, and I've been brining meat and smoking for 30 years now.  Their BBQ sauce is decent, but certainly nowhere near "piss" as one person made in his brief and highly negative comments.  I think it is better than many BBQ sauces offered at restaurants.  My guess, this reviewer owns a restaurant nearby and isn't happy Bobby Q's will take business away.  Bobby Q's is similar in ways to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen in Peoria - which is my favorite fish restaurant in AZ, and beyond and so is Bobby Q's my favorite BBQ joint.  Yeah I've had a particular item that is better at another restaurants somewhere in the nation, but these 2 restaurants are favorites because they always deliver a consitent "Yum," and occasional "Wow!"   In my life, I got to spend a lot of time in Louisiana and eat at 5-star restaurants where a particular fish dish was amazing.  Again, what makes Bobby Qs and Pappadeuax a favorite is their extensive menus in a particular food type, and the food served is always very good to amazing depending on what is ordered, and when.  There is never just a decent, or sub par experience at either of these restaurants.  I always leave saying, "Man that was GOOD," or "Wow, that was Amazing!"   I've always left Booby Qs wanting to come back again the same week, if I could.  As a point of reference to a reader, let me say that the Cheesecake Factory I believe tries to do something like this with a vast and varied menu, but I think they fail at it where Bobby Q's doesn't.  I've only had sub-par to decent food at Cheesecake Factory excluding their cheesecakes which never disappoints!  For me, the Cheesecake Factory has never delivered amazing food where Bobby Q's has.  Also, I think the Elephant Bar with it's varied menu as being maybe one step above the Cheesecake Factory in regards to taste of the entrees - they are consistently good.

VhNtF1oxokrIHIPVIRPotg.text: Food was very good. Great atmosphere and staff was very friendly. Highly recommend!! Ask for Rachel great server..   very  knowledgeable..

_fUr4PU8BCmzMuw6-Zw9Lg.text: The server was great and very friendly. The food was sub par, and overpriced for the taste and quality. The potatoes tasted like powder packaged potatoes. Very nice interior but food leaves a lot to be desired.

axhcC5_ULn1deOMoQ9E4sw.text: The most amazing brisket I have ever had!  Very tender and flavorful!  And the baby back ribs were to die for!  Service was fantastic! I would definitely recommend trying this place if you are ever in Phoenix!

jHbTtDIXt-hBNajN5wdLQw.text: I took my husband here for Father's Day and he loved it, we all loved it. The atmosphere was very inviting, our server was helpful and so pleasant. The food was delicious, I especially enjoyed the Mac and cheese. We live in Gilbert but we will be back to this location.

geKnJPO_6RXrirlwpuo-CA.text: Wasn't going to give such a high review, but the service exceeded expectations. Riley was so attentive and friendly. A guest in our party had an allergy and he did everything possible to make sure our needs were met.

kqA1SCmjFpSHTOm4U2sZiw.text: Good Service with Good Food! Also, they give you a package of donuts with your receipt. Love this place.

N2iepT0noRY73lx0puYmWw.text: Had such a good experience at Bobby Q Biltmore last night. We got there on a Friday around 7pm and were sat right away on their nice heated patio. Our server Joe was awesome and always on top of his stuff. The food came out really quickly after ordering and was delicious. We were both very pleased and will be back!!

EhlB3ujxspOwaLI_aRF0Eg.text: Nice place.  Good food and service.  They do smoked turkeys and prime ribs for the holidays in addition to their normal take out menu.  I ordered both for Christmas and they were very good.  I did have to pick them up at the I-17 location.

0nkraCdzAmj7bmSyEaVvFQ.text: In a word:  WOW!  As I've said in previous reviews, Traci and I are fortunate to live in the 85018 with so many fantastic restaurants in the area - practically within walking distance.  As others may have said, this is a crowed Safeway shopping center, and it starts with parking.  Don't get all crapped out trying to find a place to park if one's not nearby the restaurant.  Learn the local way - use the complimentary valet parking area dedicated to the two restaurants just to the north of the restaurant off 32nd Street.  You'll see the signs.  Bobby Q's has big shoes to fill - the real estate / lease costs for this space has spiked dramatically over the years.  Mexx32 was awesome, and Lenny made that cool place work to his credit, but Bobby Q's gutted much of the restaurant to enhance the bar/patio/seating, so they have made an incredible investment in the place.  Was it worth it?  We think so!  Six to eight months of the year they'll benefit from the patio/bar combo area - which we love in a restaurant.  Very inviting, friendly and an open greeting when entering.  Terrific addition!  As we all know, service is key to a successful restaurant, so they did the smart thing:  Got a bartender who knows his stuff and who has worked for them at another location in the Valley.  Chris knows his way around the menu and the cocktail choices.  He was helpful and knowledgeable.  He recommended two of his favorite 'brown liquor' choices and we were not disappointed.  Both delicious and beautifully presented.  The rubber meets the road with good food, and the melt-in-your-mouth cornbread did not disappoint in getting our appetite in high gear.  Because it was our first time in (and won't be our last for sure!) we decided to try the "Whole Hog Heaven".  GREAT call!  A little of everything... Perfect for 2 or 3 people if you bring your appetite.  We just about finished it - but not quite.  Delicious, smokey, tender and flavorful baby back ribs or beef ribs (Pick both) AND your choice of two:  pork, prime brisket, sausage or chicken.  AND three sides (think the best BBQ choices in your mind and they'll be there).  Bottom line:  we liked EVERYTHING.  But If there was one criticism - it's the beef ribs are work.  They're not 'fall off the bone' like the baby backs.  A bit messy, but delicious.  Ultimately, we had a fantastic meal!  Great service!  Amazing ambiance!  What more do you need or want?  Highly recommend going to Bobby Q's!  You'll be able to personalize your meal and your head start is checking out their menu before you go.  A must - just be prepared for your mouth to start watering!  :)    Enjoy!

6hWaqlfjoYAZ7FrD92LoFA.text: Let me preface, I am a Kansas City girl and know my barbecue. First of all, I ordered burnt ends and a half a slab of baby back ribs. The flavor was perfect and really did not need sauce. I did use a little and their spicy was perfect. One thing though, I called and asked if they had burnt ends and the girl said they did but they were on the menu. What I got was brisket and nothing about them resembled "burnt ends". Overall I thought it was very good. Enjoy!

UpGlX1a7EI0J09jy6_Q9SA.text: That brisket... just amazing! Got the Whole Hog meal for 2 and had leftovers for days. Yum! Definitely try the sangria because it tastes like wine candy juice. And the service was just great. We'll definitely be back!
